question: you have recently missed a project deadline which resulted in your company lossing an important client. write a letter to your senior director. in your letter apologise for what happened explain why you missed the dead line tell him her how will you avoid in future
text: I am writing this letter to you to apologize, for my huge mistake which leads to the dissatisfaction of our old client.
Firstly, I have to apologize to you, because my mistake about this  happened had a significant impact on our situation. And create undesirable conditions to continue our cooperation.

Actually, as you know, when we make a contract with fly butter company , they offered another date to deliver all products to them ,however, after more discussion, the date was set a few days earlier. But unfortunately, I thought the first deadline was correct.

I completely agree that my mistake creates huge problems for our company and I promise after that I consider all dates of our contract and try to negotiate again to them and I hopefuls due to my relationship can consider a new deadline.
Thank you for taking your time and your consideration of my letter.
